author: rokejulianlockhart
body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] Write a descriptive title.
- [ ] Make sure you are able to repro it on the [latest released version](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases)
- [X] Search the existing issues.
- [X] Refer to the [FAQ](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/FAQ.md).
- [X] Refer to [Differences between Windows PowerShell 5.1 and PowerShell](https://docs.microsoft.com/powershell/scripting/whats-new/differences-from-windows-powershell).

### Steps to reproduce

When response from the utiliser of PowerShell has been necessary, PowerShell has responded automatically without failure after invocation of "START-TRANSCRIPT -APPEND -NOCLOBBER -INCLUDEINVOCATIONHEADER".

Response has not occurred without previous invocation of "START-TRANSCRIPT -APPEND -NOCLOBBER -INCLUDEINVOCATIONHEADER".

### Expected behavior

Solicitation of response by "/usr/bin/flatpak" after invocation of "START-TRANSCRIPT -APPEND -NOCLOBBER -INCLUDEINVOCATIONHEADER" via "/opt/microsoft/powershell/7/pwsh" without automatic response.

PowerShell 7.2.1
Copyright (c) Microsoft Corporation.

https://aka.ms/powershell
Type 'help' to get help.

PS /> START-TRANSCRIPT -APPEND -NOCLOBBER -INCLUDEINVOCATIONHEADER
Transcript started, output file is /home/BEEDELLROKEJULIANLOCKHART/PowerShell_transcript.fedora.dyCrnPp8.20220108184543.txt
PS /> flatpak --verbose -vv --ostree-verbose install --installation=default --or-update org.kde.dolphin.Debug
F: Opening system flatpak installation at path /var/lib/flatpak
Looking for matches?
F: Calling system helper: GenerateOciSummary
F: Fetching summary index file for remote ?flathub?
F: Loading https://dl.flathub.org/repo/summary.idx using libsoup
F: Received 2737 bytes
F: Loaded indexed summary file 8bc8f01224e2e3c231e4d0a601f67c33ea14e9c37d5fffe4cddf003a1f777a92 from cache for remote ?flathub?
F: Fetching summary index file for remote ?flathub-beta?
F: Loading https://dl.flathub.org/beta-repo/summary.idx using libsoup
F: Received 2687 bytes

F: Fetching summary index file for remote ?gnome-nightly?
F: Loading https://nightly.gnome.org/repo/summary.idx using libsoup

F: Fetching summary index file for remote ?kdeapps?
F: Loading http://distribute.kde.org/flatpak-apps-testing/summary.idx using libsoup
F: Received 910 bytes

F: Fetching summary index file for remote ?org.mozilla.FirefoxRepo?
F: Loading https://firefox-flatpak.mojefedora.cz/repo/summary.idx using libsoup
F: Fetching summary file for remote ?org.mozilla.FirefoxRepo?

F: GnuPG >= 2.1.17, skipping gpg-agent cleanup in /tmp/ostree-gpg-SmcmNw

BAD signature from " <julian@richen.io>"

BAD signature from " <julian@richen.io>"
Key expired Tue Jun  9 18:16:34 2020

   1) ?flathub? (system)
   2) ?kdeapps? (system)

Which do you want to use (0 to abort)? [0-2]: 

### Actual behavior

Automatic response to solicitation of response by "/usr/bin/flatpak" after invocation of "START-TRANSCRIPT -APPEND -NOCLOBBER -INCLUDEINVOCATIONHEADER" via "/opt/microsoft/powershell/7/pwsh".

PowerShell 7.2.1
Copyright (c) Microsoft Corporation.

Type 'help' to get help.

### Error details

_No response_

### Environment data

PS /home/BEEDELLROKEJULIANLOCKHART> Write-Output $PSVersionTable

----                           -----

_No response_

comments.author: rokejulianlockhart
comments.body: This problem has been reported at "http://github.com/flatpak/flatpak/issues/4657".

comments.author: rokejulianlockhart
comments.body: PowerShell additionally does not present the prompt that "file://localhost//usr/bin/dnf" provides when invoked by shells that are compliant to POSIX. This is problematic because without that, the software appears to have indefinitely hesitated/ceased operation.

title: [Bug]: Automatic response to solicitation of response by the consequence of compilation of "http://github.com/flatpak/flatpak" subsequent to invocation of "Start-Transcript -Append -NoClobber -IncludeInvocationHeader".
